alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 11:43PM MST until January 31 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing and drifting snow expected significantly reducing visibility. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Northern and Southern High Plains adjacent to the Rocky Mountain Front, Gates of the Mountains, and lower elevations of Cascade, Judith Basin, and Fergus Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until Noon MST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel difficulties are possible due to low visibility in blowing and drifting snow. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is a low potential for ground blizzard conditions with more widespread hazardous impacts to develop Monday afternoon and persist into Tuesday.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
